channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2025050422
item.description:
Report X-2025050422

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-02T15:18:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. Inside of the fiberboard box were plastic bottles with screw on spray caps. Five of the plastic bottles had damaged screw cap spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a plastic jerrycan was dropped during the loading process. This resulted in a small puncture on the top of the jerrycan causing a release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025050040
item.description:
Report E-2025050040

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-02T15:18:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 16:34 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal BNA. It was reported that approximately 6 ounces of Whitaker Methyl Ethyl Ketone released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to a loose cap on the drum. The release impacted trailer #3193231. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste labels 233341-1 and 233341-2 were created. Waste label 233341-1 one 65-gallon metal drum containing one 55-gallon metal drum. Waste label 233341-2 one 10-gallon metal drum containing oil dri with absorbed product.
